intro: Ceropegia maccannii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a trailing or climbing species, with succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia maccannii is popular among succulent enthusiasts due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
